metadata.Title: CVE-2020-13568 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description: SQL injection vulnerability exists in phpGACL 3.3.7. A specially craftedHTTP request can lead to a SQL injection. An attacker can send an HTTPrequest to trigger this vulnerability in admin/edit_group.php, when thePOST parameter action is “Submit”, the POST parameter parent_id leads to aSQL injection.

criterions.comment: phpgacl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
